citation.article-title: Sediminibacterium salmoneum gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the phylum Bacteroidetes isolated from sediment of a eutrophic reservoir.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Sediminibacterium (Se′di.mi.ni.bac.te′ri.um. L. n. sedimen -inis sediment; L. neut. n. bacterium a rod; N.L. neut. n. Sediminibacterium a rod from sediment).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-negative rods.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 1 G, iso-C15 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C16 : 0 3-OH, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 1 A and iso-C15 : 0 3-OH.
The type species is Sediminibacterium salmoneum.
Phylogenetically related to the genera Terrimonas and Niabella in the phylum Bacteroidetes.
